Use R to find the probability that the student gets more than 2 questions right, P(X > 2).
Guidance: R will calculate for us only probabilities of the type P(X = k) or P(X ≤ k). To find P(X > 2), think Complement Event.

To find P(X > 2), we notice that the complement rule of the event "X > 2" is X ≤ 2, and therefore P(X > 2) = 1 âˆ’ P(X ≤ 2). R gives us:
> 1-pbinom(2,10,0.2) [1] 0.3222005
Thus, there is approximately a 32% chance that, using the guessing strategy, the student will get more than 2 questions right on the quiz.
